00054 struct ToLower{ char operator() (char c) const { return tolower(c); } };
00055 struct ToUpper{ char operator() (char c) const { return toupper(c); } };
00056 
00057 static inline string
00058 upper(string str){
00059   transform (str.begin(), str.end(), str.begin(), ToUpper());
00060   return str;
00061 }
00062 
00063 static inline string
00064 lower(string str){
00065   transform (str.begin(), str.end(), str.begin(), ToLower());
00066   return str;
00067 }

00078 Err::Err(Err::ErrTp _terr, const string & mod, const string & msg){
00079   terr = _terr;
00080   module = mod;
00081   message = msg;

00085 void
00086 Err::report() const {
00087   switch ( terr ) {
00088   case Err::WARN:  cerr << "WARNING!";     break;
00089   case Err::ERR:   cerr << "ERROR!";       break;
00090   case Err::FATAL: cerr << "FATAL ERROR!"; break;
00091   }
00092   cerr << " In module \'" << module << "\'. " << message << endl;
00093 }

00105 static inline Err
00106 warn_parse(const string & type_name, const string & in,
00107            const string &msg){
00108   return warn("parsing "+type_name, "String \""+in+"\": " +
00109               ( msg.empty() ? string("<no info>") : msg ) + ".");
00110 }

00120 static inline int
00121 get_terminal_width(){
00122 #ifdef _WIN32
00123   CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO info;
00124   HANDLE fd = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
00125   if (fd == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00126     return 0;
00127   return GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo (fd, &info) ? info.dwSize.X - 1 : 0;
00128 #else
00129   winsize size;
00130   return ( ioctl (STDIN_FILENO, TIOCGWINSZ, &size )<0 ) ?  0 : size.ws_col - 1;
00131 #endif
00132 }

00134 
00150 static string
00151 print_table(const string & instr,
00152             string::size_type space=string::npos) {
00153 
00154   if( space == string::npos)
00155     space=get_terminal_width();
00156 
00157   string out;
00158   string::size_type idx=0, nidx=0, togo=0;
00159 
00160   if ( instr.empty() )
00161     return out;
00162 
00163   while (idx != string::npos) {
00164 
00165     if ( nidx = instr.find('\n', idx),
00166          nidx != string::npos && nidx < idx+space )  {
00167       out += instr.substr(idx, nidx-idx) + "\n";
00168       idx = nidx+1;
00169     } else if ( idx+space > instr.length() ) { // end reached
00170       out += instr.substr(idx);
00171       idx = string::npos;
00172     } else if ( nidx = instr.rfind(' ', idx+space),
00173                 nidx != string::npos && nidx > idx ) {
00174       out += instr.substr(idx, nidx-idx) + "\n";
00175       idx = nidx+1;
00176     } else {
00177       out += instr.substr(idx, space-1) + "\n";
00178       idx += space-1;
00179     }
00180 
00181   }
00182 
00183   return out;
00184 
00185 }

00187 
00197 void
00198 prefix_out(const string & original, const string & prefix = "",
00199            bool firstline=true){
00200   if(original.empty())
00201     return;
00202 
00203   if (firstline)
00204     cout << prefix;
00205 
00206   string::size_type idx=0, nidx=0;
00207 
00208   while ( nidx = original.find('\n', idx),
00209           nidx != string::npos && nidx != original.length()-1 ) {
00210     cout << original.substr(idx,nidx-idx) << endl
00211          <<  prefix;
00212     idx=nidx+1;
00213   }
00214   cout << original.substr(idx);
00215 
00216 }

00236 
00250 Option::Option
00251 ( Kind _kind, void * _val, int (*_convert)(void*, const std::string &) ,
00252   const char _char_name, const std::string & _long_name,
00253   const std::string & _short_desc, const std::string & _long_desc,
00254   const std::string & _arg_desc, const std::string & _dflt,
00255   bool _isarray) :
00256   kind(_kind),
00257   val(_val),
00258   long_name(_long_name),
00259   char_name(_char_name),
00260   arg_desc(_arg_desc),
00261   short_desc(_short_desc),
00262   long_desc(_long_desc),
00263   convert(_convert),
00264   dflt(_dflt),
00265   isarray(_isarray),
00266   counter(0)
00267 {
00268   if ( ( kind == ARGUMENT || kind == OPTION ) && ( !val || !convert )  )
00269     throw_error("construct option",
00270                 "Arguments and options must always have non-zero value"
00271                 " and conversion function.");
00272   if ( kind == ARGUMENT && ( short_desc.empty() || long_name.empty() ) )
00273     throw_error("construct option",
00274                 "Arguments must always have \"short description\" and"
00275                 " name fields filled.");
00276   if ( kind == OPTION && short_desc.empty() )
00277     throw_error("construct option",
00278                 "Options must always have \"short description\" field.");
00279 }

00281 
00291 std::string
00292 Option::delim_opt(const std::string & delim, bool keep_format) const {
00293   if (kind == OPTION) {
00294 
00295     string ret;
00296 
00297     if (char_name) ret += string("-") + string(1, char_name);
00298     else if (keep_format) ret += "  ";
00299 
00300     if ( char_name && ! long_name.empty() ) ret += delim;
00301     else if (keep_format) ret += string(delim.length(), ' ');
00302 
00303     ret += "--" + long_name;
00304 
00305     return ret;
00306 
00307   } else if (kind == ARGUMENT) {
00308     return "<" + long_name + ">";
00309   } else {
00310     return "";
00311   }
00312 }

00320 string
00321 Option::desc(bool keep_format) const {
00322   return delim_opt(", ", keep_format);
00323 }

00326 void
00327 Option::usage() const {
00328   if (kind == OPTION)
00329     cout << delim_opt(" ");
00330   else if (kind == ARGUMENT)
00331     cout << "<" << long_name << (isarray ? "..." : "")  << ">";
00332 }

00334 
00335 void
00336 Option::Usage() const {
00337   if (kind == OPTION) {
00338     cout << "[" << delim_opt("|");
00339     if ( ! arg_desc.empty() ) cout << "=" << arg_desc;
00340     cout << "]";
00341   } else if (kind == ARGUMENT) {
00342     cout << "<" << long_name << " (" << arg_desc << ")" << ">";
00343   }
00344 }
00345 
00346 
00352 void
00353 Option::help(const int descwidth, const int argwidth) const {
00354 
00355   string descs = desc(true);
00356   int const_part = indent + descwidth + indent + argwidth + indent;
00357 
00358   if (kind == OPTION || kind == ARGUMENT) {
00359     cout << sindent << descs << string(descwidth-descs.length(),' ')
00360          << sindent << arg_desc << string(argwidth-arg_desc.length(),' ')
00361          << sindent;
00362     prefix_out
00363       ( print_table(short_desc, get_terminal_width()-const_part),
00364         string(const_part, ' '), false);
00365     cout << endl;
00366   } else if (kind == NOTE) {
00367     prefix_out(short_desc, sindent, false);
00368     if ( ! short_desc.empty() ) cout << endl;
00369   }
00370 
00371 }
00372 
00373 
00374 void
00375 Option::Help() const {
00376 
00377   const int width = get_terminal_width();
00378 
00379   if (kind == OPTION) {
00380     cout << sindent << delim_opt(", ") << sindent << arg_desc << endl;
00381     if ( ! short_desc.empty()) {
00382       prefix_out( print_table(short_desc, width-2*indent), sindent+sindent);
00383       cout << endl;
00384     }
00385     if ( ! long_desc.empty()) {
00386       prefix_out( print_table(long_desc, width-2*indent), sindent+sindent);
00387       cout << endl;
00388     }
00389   } else if (kind == ARGUMENT) {
00390     cout << sindent << "<" << long_name << sindent << "(" << arg_desc << ")>" << endl;
00391     if ( ! short_desc.empty()) {
00392       prefix_out( print_table(short_desc, width-2*indent), sindent+sindent);
00393       cout << endl;
00394     }
00395     if ( ! long_desc.empty()) {
00396       prefix_out( print_table(long_desc, width-2*indent), sindent+sindent);
00397       cout << endl;
00398     }
00399   } else if (kind == NOTE) {
00400     if ( ! short_desc.empty()) {
00401       cout << print_table(short_desc, width);
00402       cout << endl;
00403     }
00404     if ( ! long_desc.empty()) {
00405       prefix_out( print_table(long_desc, width-2*indent), sindent+sindent);
00406       cout << endl;
00407     }
00408   }
00409 
00410 }

00413 
00414 void
00415 Option::man() const {
00416 
00417   switch (kind) {
00418 
00419   case OPTION :
00420 
00421     cout << ".TP" << endl;
00422     if (char_name) cout << "\\fB\\-" << char_name << "\\fR";
00423     if ( char_name && ! long_name.empty() ) cout << ", ";
00424     if ( ! long_name.empty() ) cout << "\\fB\\-\\-" << long_name << "\\fR";
00425     if ( ! arg_desc.empty() ) cout << "=\\fI" << arg_desc << "\\fR";
00426     cout << endl;
00427 
00428     if ( ! short_desc.empty() || ! long_desc.empty() ) {
00429       cout << ".RS" << endl;
00430       cout << short_desc;
00431       if ( ! short_desc.empty() ) cout << endl;
00432       if ( ! short_desc.empty() && ! long_desc.empty() ) cout << ".br" << endl;
00433       prefix_out(long_desc, ".br\n",false);
00434       if ( ! long_desc.empty() ) cout << endl;
00435       cout << ".RE" << endl;
00436     }
00437 
00438     break;
00439 
00440   case ARGUMENT :
00441 
00442     cout << ".TP" << endl;
00443     cout << "\\fB<" << long_name << ">\\fR" << endl;
00444 
00445     if ( ! short_desc.empty() || ! long_desc.empty() ) {
00446       cout << ".RS" << endl;
00447       cout << short_desc;
00448       if ( ! short_desc.empty() ) cout << endl;
00449       if ( ! short_desc.empty() && ! long_desc.empty() ) cout << ".br" << endl;
00450       prefix_out(long_desc, ".br\n",false);
00451       if ( ! long_desc.empty() ) cout << endl;
00452       cout << ".RE" << endl;
00453     }
00454 
00455     break;
00456 
00457   case NOTE:
00458     cout << ".RS" << endl;
00459     if ( short_desc.empty() ) {
00460       prefix_out(long_desc, ".br\n",false);
00461       cout << endl;
00462     } else if ( long_desc.empty() ) {
00463       cout << ".SH " << short_desc << endl;
00464     } else {
00465       cout << ".SS " << short_desc << endl
00466            << ".br" << endl;
00467       prefix_out(long_desc, ".br\n",false);
00468       cout << endl;
00469     }
00470     cout << ".RE" << endl;
00471     break;
00472 
00473   case MAN:
00474     if ( ! short_desc.empty() )
00475       cout << ".br" << endl
00476            << ".SH " << short_desc << endl
00477            << ".br" << endl;
00478     cout << long_desc << endl;
00479     break;
00480 
00481   default:
00482     break;
00483 
00484   }
00485 
00486 }

00489 bool
00490 Option::require_arg() const {
00491   return ! arg_desc.empty();
00492 }
00493 
00494 
00501 bool
00502 Option::parse(const string & acquire){
00503   if ( !val || !convert )
00504     throw_error("parse entry", "Attempt to perform conversion on the entry"
00505                 " which has no converter. Looks like a bug in the code.");
00506  if (counter && ! isarray)
00507    throw_error("parse entry", "Option \"" + delim_opt("|") + "\""
00508                " cannot be used more than one time.");
00509   int words = convert(val, acquire);
00510   if ( words < 0 ) {
00511     string errmsg;
00512     errmsg += "Failed to convert the string \"";
00513     errmsg += acquire;
00514     errmsg += "\" to the value of the parameter \"";
00515     errmsg += delim_opt("|");
00516     if ( ! arg_desc.empty() )
00517       errmsg += string(" of type \"") + arg_desc + string("\"");
00518     errmsg += ".";
00519     throw_error("parse entry", errmsg);
00520   }
00521   ++counter;
00522   return words != 0;
00523 }

00546 #ifdef POPTMX_MAN_KEY
00547 const string OptionTable::manLN = POPTMX_MAN_KEY;
00548 #else
00549 const string OptionTable::manLN = "-very-long-key-phrase-to-output-man-pages";
00550 #endif

00554 
00559 OptionTable::OptionTable(const string & _general_desc,
00560                          const string & _general_long_desc,
00561                          const string & _general_synopsis) :
00562   general_desc(_general_desc), general_long_desc(_general_long_desc),
00563   general_synopsis(_general_synopsis) {
00564 
00565   name("");
00566   helpme=false;
00567   useme=false;
00568   beverb=false;
00569   auto_help=0;
00570   auto_use=0;
00571   auto_verb=0;
00572 
00573 }

00578 int
00579 OptionTable::size() const {
00580   return options.size();
00581 }
00582 
00589 OptionTable::ListO
00590 OptionTable::find(const void * _val) const {
00591   for (ListO icur = options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++)
00592     if ( icur->val == _val)
00593       return icur;
00594   return options.end();
00595 }
00596 
00603 OptionTable::ListO
00604 OptionTable::find(char _char_name) const {
00605   if ( ! _char_name )
00606     return options.end();
00607   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++)
00608     if ( icur->char_name == _char_name &&
00609          ( icur->kind == ARGUMENT || icur->kind == OPTION ) )
00610       return icur;
00611   return options.end();
00612 }
00613 
00620 OptionTable::ListO
00621 OptionTable::find(const string & _long_name) const {
00622   if ( _long_name.empty() )
00623     return options.end();
00624   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++)
00625     if ( icur->long_name == _long_name &&
00626          ( icur->kind == ARGUMENT || icur->kind == OPTION ) )
00627       return icur;
00628   return options.end();
00629 }
00630 
00637 OptionTable::ListO
00638 OptionTable::find() const {
00639   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++)
00640     if ( icur->kind == ARGUMENT && ( icur->isarray || ! icur->counter ) )
00641       return icur;
00642   return options.end();
00643 }
00644 
00645 
00652 OptionTable::ListO
00653 OptionTable::has_array() const {
00654   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++)
00655     if ( icur->kind == ARGUMENT && icur->isarray )
00656       return icur;
00657   return options.end();
00658 }

00662 
00663 
00664 bool
00665 OptionTable::parse(int argc, char *argv[]){
00666 
00667   // Reread all possible pointers.
00668   replacePointers(general_desc);
00669   replacePointers(general_long_desc);
00670   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++) {
00671     replacePointers(icur->short_desc);
00672     replacePointers(icur->long_desc);
00673   }
00674 
00675   if ( !argv )
00676     throw_error("parse parameters", "Zero-pointer to the parameters' array.");
00677   if ( argc < 1 )
00678     throw_error("parse parameters", "argc is not what it is meant to be.");
00679 
00680   const std::list<std::string> Argv(argv, argv+argc);
00681   const ListS cliend = Argv.end();
00682 
00683 
00684   // Prepares general information.
00685   if (general_name.empty())
00686     name(Argv.front());
00687   if ( general_synopsis.empty() ) {
00688     general_synopsis = name() + " [OPTIONS...]";
00689     for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; ++icur)
00690       if ( icur->kind == ARGUMENT)
00691         general_synopsis += " <" + icur->long_name + (icur->isarray ? "..." : "") + ">";
00692   }
00693 
00694   // Triggers man if needed.
00695   ListS clicur = Argv.begin();
00696   while ( ++clicur != cliend)
00697     if ( *clicur == manLN ) {
00698       man();
00699       return false;
00700     }
00701 
00702   // Empty options
00703   if (options.empty()) {
00704     unused = list<string>(++(Argv.begin()),cliend);
00705     return true;
00706   }
00707 
00708   // Parses CLI phrase.
00709   bool no_more_options = false;
00710   clicur = ++(Argv.begin());
00711   while ( clicur != cliend) {
00712 
00713     const ListO tblend = options.end();
00714 
00715     if ( clicur->empty() ) {
00716       warn("parse parameters", "Empty string as the parameter. Will skip.");
00717       ++clicur;
00718 
00719     } else if ( clicur->at(0) != '-' || no_more_options ) {   // argument
00720       ListO tblarg = find();
00721       if (tblarg==tblend)
00722         unused.push_back(*clicur);
00723       else
00724         tblarg->parse(*clicur);
00725       ++clicur;
00726 
00727     } else if ( *clicur == "-" ) { // special case
00728       ++clicur;
00729 
00730     } else if ( *clicur == "--" ) { // end of options
00731       no_more_options = true;
00732       ++clicur;
00733 
00734     } else if ( ! clicur->compare(0,2,"--") ) { // long option
00735       ListO tblopt = find(clicur->substr(2));
00736       if (tblopt==tblend)
00737         throw_error("parse CLI", "Unknown option \"" + *clicur + "\".");
00738       ++clicur;
00739       if ( tblopt->require_arg() && clicur == cliend )
00740         throw_error("parse option", "Option \"" + tblopt->delim_opt("|") +"\""
00741                     " is missing required argument.");
00742       tblopt->parse ( clicur == cliend ? string("") : *clicur );
00743       if ( tblopt->require_arg() )
00744         ++clicur;
00745 
00746 
00747     } else { // short option
00748       string elements=*clicur++;
00749       for (unsigned el = 1 ; el < elements.length() ; ++el) {
00750         char short_name=elements[el];
00751         ListO tblopt = find(short_name);
00752         if (tblopt==tblend)
00753           throw_error("parse CLI", "Unknown option \"-" + string(1,short_name) + "\".");
00754         if ( tblopt->require_arg() && clicur == cliend )
00755           throw_error("parse option", "Option \"" + tblopt->delim_opt("|") +"\""
00756                       " is missing required argument.");
00757         tblopt->parse ( clicur == cliend ? string("") : *clicur );
00758         if ( tblopt->require_arg() )
00759           ++clicur;
00760       }
00761     }
00762 
00763   }
00764 
00765   if ( auto_help && *auto_help ) {
00766     auto_verb && *auto_verb   ?  Help() : help() ;
00767     return false;
00768   } else if ( auto_use && *auto_use ) {
00769     auto_verb && *auto_verb  ?  Usage() : usage() ;
00770     return false;
00771   }
00772   return true;
00773 
00774 }

00784 
00785 void
00786 OptionTable::usage() const {
00787 
00788   cout << general_desc << endl
00789        << name();
00790 
00791 
00792   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; ++icur) {
00793     cout << " ";
00794     icur->usage();
00795   }
00796   cout << endl;
00797 
00798   if ( auto_help || auto_verb ) {
00799     cout << "Use options ";
00800     if (auto_help) cout << find(auto_help)->delim_opt("|");
00801     if (auto_help && auto_verb) cout << " ";
00802     if (auto_verb) cout << find(auto_verb)->delim_opt("|");
00803     cout << " for more info." << endl;
00804   }
00805 
00806 }
00807 
00808 void
00809 OptionTable::Usage() const {
00810   cout << general_desc << endl
00811        << print_table(general_long_desc) << endl
00812        << "USAGE:" << endl;
00813   prefix_out(general_synopsis, sindent);
00814   cout << endl
00815        << "All parameters:" << endl;
00816   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; ++icur){
00817     cout << " ";
00818     icur->Usage();
00819   }
00820   cout << endl;
00821 
00822   if ( auto_help || auto_verb ) {
00823     cout << "Use options ";
00824     if (auto_use)  cout << find(auto_use)->delim_opt("|") << " ";
00825     if (auto_help) cout << find(auto_help)->delim_opt("|") << " ";
00826     if (auto_verb) cout << find(auto_verb)->delim_opt("|");
00827     if (auto_help && auto_verb) cout << " and their combinations";
00828     cout << " for more info." << endl;
00829   }
00830 
00831 }
00832 
00833 void
00834 OptionTable::help() const {
00835 
00836   cout << general_desc << endl
00837        << "USAGE:" << endl;
00838   prefix_out(general_synopsis, sindent);
00839   cout << endl;
00840 
00841   int descwidth=0, argwidth=0, curlen;
00842   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++) {
00843     if ( descwidth < (curlen = icur->desc(true).length() ) )
00844       descwidth = curlen;
00845     if ( argwidth  < (curlen = icur->arg_desc.length() ) )
00846       argwidth = curlen;
00847   }
00848 
00849   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++)
00850     icur->help(descwidth, argwidth);
00851 
00852 }
00853 
00854 void
00855 OptionTable::Help() const {
00856 
00857   cout << print_table(general_desc) << endl
00858        << print_table(general_long_desc) << endl
00859        << "USAGE:" << endl;
00860   prefix_out(print_table(general_synopsis), sindent, true);
00861   cout << endl;
00862 
00863   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++)
00864     icur->Help();
00865 
00866 }

00870 
00871 void
00872 OptionTable::man() const {
00873 
00874   string version="";
00875 #ifdef VERSION
00876   version=VERSION;
00877 #endif
00878 
00879   string package="";
00880 #ifdef PACKAGE_STRING
00881   package=PACKAGE_STRING;
00882 #elif PACKAGE
00883   package=PACKAGE;
00884 #else
00885   package=name();
00886 #endif
00887 
00888   string date="";
00889 #ifdef _config_date
00890   date=_config_date;
00891 #endif
00892 
00893   cout << ".TH " << upper(name()) << " \"1\" \"" << date << "\" \""
00894        << package << "\" \"User Commands\"" << endl
00895        << ".SH NAME" << endl
00896        << name() << " \\- " << general_desc << endl
00897        << ".SH SYNOPSIS" << endl;
00898   prefix_out(general_synopsis, ".br\n.B ");
00899   cout << endl
00900        << ".SH DESCRIPTION" << endl
00901        << ".PP" << endl;
00902   prefix_out(general_long_desc, ".br\n",false);
00903   cout << endl;
00904 
00905   for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++) {
00906     cout << "./ START OPTION" << endl;
00907     icur->man();
00908     cout << "./ END OPTION" << endl
00909          << "./" << endl;
00910   }
00911 
00912 }

00919 
00925 OptionTable &
00926 OptionTable::add(const Option &opt){
00927 
00928   if ( has(opt.char_name) )
00929     throw_error("add option", (string)
00930                 "Option with the char name '" + opt.char_name +
00931                 "' already exists in the table (description: \"" +
00932                 find(opt.char_name)->short_desc + "\").");
00933   if ( has(opt.long_name ) )
00934     throw_error("add option",
00935                 "Option with the long name \"" + opt.long_name +
00936                 "\" already exists in the table (description: \"" +
00937                 find(opt.long_name)->short_desc + "\").");
00938   if ( opt.kind == ARGUMENT && opt.isarray && has_array() != options.end() )
00939       throw_error("add option", "Cannot add the argument \"" + opt.desc() + "\""
00940                   " to the table because it already has the array-argument "
00941                   " \"" + has_array()->desc() + "\".");
00942 
00943   options.push_back(opt);
00944   return *this;
00945 
00946 }
00947 
00948 
00949 
00950 
00965 OptionTable &
00966 OptionTable::add(Kind _kind, void * _val, int (*_convert)(void*, const string &),
00967                  const char _char_name, const string & _long_name,
00968                  const string & _short_desc, const string & _long_desc,
00969                  const string & _arg_desc, const std::string & _dflt,
00970                  bool _is_array){
00971   return add( Option(_kind, _val, _convert, _char_name, _long_name,
00972                      _short_desc, _long_desc, _arg_desc, _dflt, _is_array) );
00973 }
00974 
00988 OptionTable &
00989 OptionTable::add(Kind _kind, void * _val, int (*_convert)(void*, const string &),
00990                  const string & _long_name,
00991                  const string & _short_desc, const string & _long_desc,
00992                  const string & _arg_desc, const std::string & _dflt,
00993                  bool _is_array){
00994   if ( _kind != ARGUMENT )
00995     throw_error("add argument", "You've got the wrong add function for your kind.");
00996   return add ( Option(_kind, _val, _convert, 0, _long_name,
00997                       _short_desc, _long_desc, _arg_desc, _dflt, _is_array) );
00998 }
00999 
01000 
01014 OptionTable &
01015 OptionTable::add(Kind _kind, const string & _short_desc, const string & _long_desc){
01016   if ( _kind == NOTE )
01017     return add(_kind, 0, 0, 0, "", _short_desc, _long_desc, "", "", false);
01018   else if ( _kind == MAN ) {
01019     if ( _long_desc.empty() )
01020       return add(_kind, 0, 0, 0, "", "", _short_desc, "", "", false);
01021     else
01022       return add(_kind, 0, 0, 0, "", _short_desc, _long_desc, "", "", false);
01023   } else {
01024     throw_error("add description", "You've got the wrong add function for your kind.");
01025     return *this;
01026   }
01027 }
01028 
01029 
01035 OptionTable &
01036 OptionTable::add( const OptionTable & _val ){
01037   if ( ! _val.general_desc.empty() || ! _val.general_long_desc.empty() )
01038     add( NOTE, _val.general_desc, _val.general_long_desc);
01039   if ( ! _val.options.size() )
01040     warn("add table", "Empty table to add.");
01041   for (ListO icur=_val.options.begin() ; icur != _val.options.end() ; icur++)
01042     add(*icur);
01043   return *this;
01044 }

01050 OptionTable &
01051 OptionTable::add_verbose(bool *_beverb){
01052   if ( ! _beverb )
01053     _beverb=&beverb;
01054   add( OPTION, _beverb, 'v', "verbose", "Verbose output.", "");
01055   auto_verb = _beverb;
01056   return *this;
01057 }
01058 
01061 OptionTable &
01062 OptionTable::add_usage(bool *_useme){
01063   if ( ! _useme )
01064     _useme = &useme;
01065   add( OPTION, _useme, '?', "usage", "Outputs brief usage message.", "");
01066   auto_use = _useme;
01067   return *this;
01068 }

01072 OptionTable &
01073 OptionTable::add_help(bool *_helpme){
01074   if ( ! _helpme )
01075     _helpme = &helpme;
01076   add( OPTION, _helpme, 'h', "help", "Outputs help message.", "");
01077   auto_help = _helpme;
01078   return *this;
01079 }
01080 
01081 
01088 OptionTable &
01089 OptionTable::add_standard_options(bool *_beverb, bool *_helpme, bool *_useme){
01090   add(NOTE, "Standard options.", "");
01091   add_verbose(_beverb);
01092   add_usage(_useme);
01093   add_help(_helpme);
01094   find(auto_help)->long_desc=
01095     "When combined with the "
01096     "\"" + find(auto_verb)->delim_opt("|") + "\""
01097     " option may output more detailed message.";
01098   return *this;
01099 }

01109 OptionTable::has(const void * _val) const {
01110   return find(_val) != options.end();
01111 }

01138 
01144 int
01145 OptionTable::count(const void * _val) const {
01146 
01147   if ( ! _val ) {
01148     int ret = 0;
01149     for (ListO icur=options.begin() ; icur != options.end() ; icur++)
01150       ret += icur->counter;
01151     return ret;
01152   }
01153 
01154   if (!has(_val))
01155     throw_error("check option", "Could not find the option in the table.");
01156   return find(_val)->counter;
01157 }
01158 
01167 string
01168 OptionTable::desc(const void * _val) const {
01169   if ( ! _val )
01170     throw_error("check option", "Zero-pointer.");
01171   if ( ! has(_val) ) {
01172     char s[128];
01173     //snprintf (s, 128, "%p", _val); // does not work on WIN32
01174     sprintf (s, "%p", _val);
01175     return pntrMark + s + pntrMark;
01176   }
01177   return find(_val)->desc();
01178 }
01179 
01180 
01181 
01187 void
01188 OptionTable::replacePointers(std::string & str){
01189   size_t pos;
01190   while ( (pos=str.find(pntrMark)) != string::npos ) {
01191     void * pntr;
01192     if ( sscanf(str.c_str()+pos+pntrMark.length(), "%p", &pntr) != 1 )
01193       throw_error("reread pointer", "Found pointer mark, but failed to read"
01194                   " the pointer from the string \""+str+"\".");
01195     if ( ! has(pntr) )
01196       throw_error("reread pointer", "Did not find requested pointer in the table.");
01197     int size = str.find(pntrMark, pos+1);
01198     if (size == string::npos)
01199       throw_error("reread pointer", "Could not find end of the pointer in the string \""+str+"\".");
01200     size += pntrMark.length() - pos ;
01201     str.replace(pos, size, desc(pntr));
01202   }
01203 }
01204 
01205 
01206 
01207 
01208 string
01209 OptionTable::name() const {
01210 #ifdef _WIN32
01211   char fname[254], ext[254];
01212   _splitpath_s( general_name.c_str(), 0, 0, 0, 0, fname, 250, ext, 250);
01213   return string(fname)+string(ext);
01214 #else
01215   size_t found = general_name.rfind('/');
01216   if (found==string::npos)
01217     return general_name;
01218   else
01219     return general_name.substr(found+1);
01220 #endif
01221 }
01222 
01228 void
01229 OptionTable::name(const string & _name) {
01230   general_name=_name;
01231 }

01239 
01240 // \defgroup Predef Predefined types.
01241 // The "_conversion()" functions in this group are used for the
01242 // parsing the "in" string into the, _val. The "type_desc()" functions
01243 // just give the name of the argument type to be used as the Option::arg_desc.
01244 //
01245 // @{
01246 
01247 
01254 int
01255 _conversion (bool* _val, const string &) {
01256   * _val = true;
01257   return 0;
01258 }
01259 
01262 string
01263 type_desc (bool*){
01264   return "";
01265 }
01266 
01267 
01268 
01276 int
01277 _conversion (string * _val, const string & in){
01278   * _val = in;
01279   return 1;
01280 }

01284 string
01285 type_desc (string*){
01286   return "STRING";
01287 }

01290 
01298 int
01299 _conversion(char * _val, const string & in){
01300   if (in.length() != 1) {
01301     warn_parse("char", in, "the string is not single-char");
01302     return -1;
01303   }
01304   *_val = in[0];
01305   return 1;
01306 }
01307

01311 type_desc(char*){
01312   return "CHAR";
01313 }

01326 int
01327 _conversion(unsigned char * _val, const string & in){
01328   if (in.length() != 1) {
01329     warn_parse("unsigned char", in, "the string is not single-char");
01330     return -1;
01331   }
01332   *_val = in[0];
01333   return 1;

01342 
01343 
01344 
01345 template<class BClass> static inline int
01346 _int_conversion(BClass * _val, const string & in) {
01347 
01348   char * tail = 0 ;
01349 
01350   errno = 0;
01351   long int inval = strtol(in.c_str(), &tail, 0);
01352   if (errno) {
01353     warn_parse(type_desc(_val), in, "value overflow");
01354     return -1;
01355   }
01356   if (tail == in.c_str()) {
01357     warn_parse(type_desc(_val), in, "does not represent a short value");
01358     return -1;
01359   }
01360 
01361   if (*tail != 0)
01362     warn_parse(type_desc(_val), in, "contains tail \"" + string(tail) + "\"");
01363 
01364   if (inval < (numeric_limits<BClass>::min)() ||
01365       inval > (numeric_limits<BClass>::max)() ) {
01366     warn_parse(type_desc(_val), in,
01367                "parsed integer value is out of the type range");
01368     return -1;
01369   }
01370 
01371   *_val = (BClass) inval;
01372   return 1;
01373 }
01374 
01375 
01376 template<class BClass> static inline int
01377 _uint_conversion(BClass * _val, const string & in) {
01378 
01379   char * tail = 0 ;
01380 
01381   errno = 0;
01382   unsigned long int inval = strtoul(in.c_str(), &tail, 0);
01383   if (errno) {
01384     warn_parse(type_desc(_val), in, "value overflow");
01385     return -1;
01386   }
01387   if (tail == in.c_str()) {
01388     warn_parse(type_desc(_val), in, "does not represent a short value");
01389     return -1;
01390   }
01391 
01392   if (*tail != 0)
01393     warn_parse(type_desc(_val), in, "contains tail \"" + string(tail) + "\"");
01394 
01395   if (inval < (numeric_limits<BClass>::min)() ||
01396       inval > (numeric_limits<BClass>::max)() ) {
01397     warn_parse(type_desc(_val), in,
01398                "parsed integer value is out of the type range");
01399     return -1;
01400   }
01401 
01402   *_val = (BClass) inval;
01403   return 1;
01404 }
01405

01418 _conversion(short * _val, const string & in){
01419   return _int_conversion(_val,in);
01420 }

01550 int
01551 _conversion(long long* _val, const string & in){
01552 
01553   char * tail = 0 ;
01554 
01555   errno = 0;
01556   long long int inval = strtoll(in.c_str(), &tail, 0);
01557   if (errno) {
01558     warn_parse("long long", in, "value overflow");
01559     return -1;
01560   }
01561   if (tail == in.c_str()) {
01562     warn_parse("long long", in, "does not represent an integer");
01563     return -1;
01564   }
01565 
01566   if (*tail != 0)
01567     warn_parse("long long", in, "contains tail \"" + string(tail) + "\"");
01568 
01569   if (inval < numeric_limits<long long>::min() ||
01570       inval > numeric_limits<long long>::max() ) {
01571     warn_parse("long long", in,
01572                "parsed integer _value is out of the type range");
01573     return -1;
01574   }
01575 
01576   *_val = (long long) inval;
01577   return 1;
01578 
01579 }
